title: New user type: temporary user
body:
I'm thinking of dividing users into the following four types:

- Superuser
- Staff
- General user
- (New) Temporary user

Description:
- Superuser is the administrator of the Django application, not the project administrator of doccano. Basically it is created by Django's `createsuperuser` command.
- Staff can sign in to the admin site just like a superuser, but with more limited permissions. A superuser or a staff can create them on the admin site.
- General users cannot sign in to the admin site, but they can create projects. A superuser or a staff can create them on the admin site.
- Temporary user is a user who can neither sign in to the admin site nor create a project. This user is mainly for annotators(cloud workers). The project administrators of doccano can create them on the project members page.

The permissions per user types are as follows:

  | Super User | Staff | General User | Temporary User
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
Admin Site |   |   |   |  
　Login | ✓ | ✓ |   |  
　Other operations | ✓ | dependes on permissions |   |  
ProjectList |   |   |   |  
　Create | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |  
　List | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓

This will help resolve Issue #920. In addition, this will allow staff and general users to create projects.

P.S.

- Within each project, the roles assigned to each user determine the permissions.
- There are three roles: Administrator, Annotator, and Auditor. The auditor is the current Approver.
